data.title: Broken encryption device
data.statement:
You must encrypt an urgent secret message.  As usual, you configure the old encryption device with the daily key and type the message using its keyboard with only digits and upper case letters.  Usually, you get a printed ribbon with the encrypted text, formatted in fixed-sized blocks of characters.  But this time nothing happens! 

The device is broken! You must send the message to your government within the next 15 minutes to save the situation.  The only chance is to write a program.

The encryption [[key]] is a number. Its leftmost digit, tells the length of each block.  The next digits tell how to place the characters of each input block into the corresponding output block.   The positions in the output blocks are numbered starting from 1. If the message does not fit into full blocks, the last block is padded with the start of the plain text.     

Example: 

  - [[key]]: `521534`   (meaning blocks of 5 characters,  the first of each block gets to the position 2, the second to position 1,  the next to position 5 and so on...;  
  - [[Message]]: "Hello, world!" 
  - Result:  in  "EHLOL OWLDR".  

This message will self-destroy in less than 15 minutes  but keep calm to get the mission done.

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

You must encrypt an urgent secret message. As usual, you configure the old encryption device with the daily key and type the message using its keyboard with only digits and upper case letters. Usually, you get a printed ribbon with the encrypted text, formatted in fixed-sized blocks of characters. But this time nothing happens!

The device is broken! You must send the message to your government within the next 15 minutes to save the situation. The only chance is to write a program.

The encryption key is a number. Its leftmost digit, tells the length of each block. The next digits tell how to place the characters of each input block into the corresponding output block. The positions in the output blocks are numbered starting from 1. If the message does not fit into full blocks, the last block is padded with the start of the plain text.

Example:

- key: 
521534
(meaning blocks of 5 characters, the first of each block gets to the position 2, the second to position 1, the next to position 5 and so on...;
- Message: "Hello, world!"
- Result: in "EHLOL OWLDR".

This message will self-destroy in less than 15 minutes but keep calm to get the mission done.
Input
Line 1 : a numeric key (its leftmost digit is N)
Line 2 : message to be encrypted.
Output
Encrypted message formatted in space-separated blocks of N characters (on a single line).
Constraints
4 ≤ length of key ≤ 10
3 ≤ N ≤ 9.
key is well formed
message is a string composed of only printable ascii characters, but may contain ones that will be ignored. Each message has at least one alphanumeric character.
Example
Input
521534
Hello, world!
Output
EHLOL OWLDR
